title: About Me
text:
My academic and professional interests include big data, machine learning, blockchain, and artificial intelligence, but you probably already knew that. Outside of work, I like:


üèÖ Sports
My favorite teams are the Golden State Warriors, San Francisco 49ers, and Tottenham Hotspur, and some of my favorite athletes include Stephen Curry, Gareth Bale, and Harry Kane. I‚Äôve also visited 18 different sports venues in 5 countries - the best, so far, have been the Panathenaic Stadium in Athens and Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in London.


üß≥ Traveling
Working for an airline gave me the unique opportunity to casually travel the world on my days off! I‚Äôve visited 25 countries and 24 U.S. states and territories. Over the years, I‚Äôve taken off 125 times and counting, comprising over a quarter of a million miles, and have spent the night in 10 different airport terminals around the world.
Some of my favorite places I‚Äôve visited are London, England; Kamakura, Japan; and Saint Petersburg, Russia.
On my list of places to see next are Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia; Phnom Penh, Cambodia; and Vatnaj√∂kull, Iceland.


üõ©Ô∏è Aviation
I often look forward to the airport and the plane ride as much as I do the vacation itself! Some of my favorite airports are San Francisco (SFO), Singapore (SIN), New Orleans (MSY), and Tokyo-Narita (NRT).
My aviation-related hobbies include arriving at SFO early to admire the Lufthansa Boeing 747-800 that flies in from Frankfurt every day, and reading Wikipedia articles about obscure airports and airlines. Currently, my favorite planes are the Boeing 787 Dreamliner and the Airbus A321neo, both of which I‚Äôve been very fortunate to fly on several times with United.

title: Projects
text:
Some of the fun stuff I‚Äôve worked on, ranging from machine learning models to sports analytics research.


üî¢ Machine Learning & Data Science

Airline Route Similarity Research
Current project I‚Äôm working on. I‚Äôm using flight telemetry data to identify possibly unexpected parallels between major U.S. flight corridors and international routes.
OpenL3 Music Recommendation System
Built my own music recommendation pipeline because I got tired of Spotify‚Äôs built-in recommendation algorithm. Feel free to try it yourself!
Large Language Model & Retrieval-Augmented Generation
Developed RAG system optimizing retrieval strategies for Meta KDD Cup 2024 CRAG benchmark.
Denoising Autoencoder for CIFAR-100
Trained a convolutional autoencoder to reconstruct noisy images and improve feature representation.
Reddit Social Network Analysis
Built a graph neural network framework for social network analysis, including GCNs, GATs, and node embeddings.




‚öæ Sports Analytics

NFLPA Analytics Case Competition
Clustered contract data of NFL players and presented data-driven recommendations to NFLPA leadership.
The Launch Angle Revolution
Examined the impact of elite MLB hitters‚Äô average launch angle on statistics and performance.
Predicting the Group Stages of the 2022 FIFA World Cup
Developed a statistical model based on statistics in qualifying to forecast results for the 2022 FIFA World Cup. Outperformed models developed by researchers at University of Oxford, Opta Sports, and others.

title: My Resume
text:
I‚Äôm a data scientist and analyst who loves turning messy data into meaningful insights. Whether it‚Äôs forecasting airline parts, breaking down baseball pitches, or predicting stock prices, I enjoy using machine learning and stats to solve real-world problems. If it involves numbers, models, and a challenge - I‚Äôm in.


Education

üá∫üá∏ University of California, Los Angeles (August 2021 - June 2025)
B.S. Mathematics of Computation and B.S. Statistics and Data Science
Relevant coursework: Data Mining, Machine Learning, Monte Carlo Methods, Statistical Theory, Data Management Systems, Computer Organization, Data Structures, Algorithms and Complexity


üá¨üáß Cambridge University (June 2022 - August 2022)
Pembroke College Summer Programme
Studied advanced mathematics and statistics while navigating British academia and accents




Professional Experience

‚úàÔ∏è Technical Operations Intern - United Airlines (June 2024 - September 2024)

Forecasted demand for airplane parts to keep flights running smoothly
Built deep neural networks on Palantir Foundry to improve inventory predictions

Transformed ETL pipelines to speed up data processing and enhance forecasting accuracy



ü¶à Business Intelligence Intern - San Jose Sharks (June 2023 - August 2023)

Analyzed fan attendance trends to predict how season ticket holders use their seats
Evaluated the effectiveness of a loyalty program, influencing future fan engagement strategies

Built Tableau dashboards that gave executives real-time insights into ticket sales and revenue



‚öæÔ∏è Baseball Analytics Consultant - UCLA Baseball (October 2022 - June 2024)

Developed an XGBoost-based model to quantify pitch effectiveness
Created a Gaussian Naive Bayes pitch classifier to help pitchers understand their tendencies

Provided insights that contributed to pitcher development and game-day strategy



ü¶† Machine Learning Operations Intern - Virufy (March 2023 - June 2023)

Helped develop AI-driven tools for detecting COVID-19 from cough sounds
Optimized ML model deployment and automated data pipelines

Improved model performance using AWS and PySpark

title: Welcome to my website!
text: I‚Äôm a data scientist and software developer with a background in machine learning, mathematics, and data analytics. I have experience in predictive modeling, time series forecasting, deep learning, and building end-to-end data solutions across multiple industries.
